ParentCompanyName: Jacobson Warehouse Co. dba XPO Logistics

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

We at Jacobson Warehouse Company, Inc.(dba XPO Logisitics) are strongly committed to employee, public and environmental

safety. This commitment is demonstrated by our activities to prevent accidental releases from the storage

and distribution processes at our facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent

possible releases of regulated substances. If such a release were to occur, emergency response personnel

are at hand to control and mitigate the effects of the release. Our site specific Emergency Action Plan

includes steps and sequence of steps to be taken including appropriate contacts to make. We are contracted

with a third party chemical incident mitigation company to assist us should any release escape into the

environment as necessary. We are also coordinated with the local fire department and local customer plant

safety personnel which provide additional emergency response expertise.

2. The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled

Our facility's primary activities are comprised of the receipt, storage and shipment of hazardous materials in

DOT approved packaged form for our customer. Currently we have product that contains Toluene diisocyanate (unspecified isomer)as part of a mixture. The product is stored

in portable containers.

3. The General Accident Release Prevention Program

Our facility has developed and implemented a prevention program to prevent any accidental releases. This

program incorporates the following elements: Safety examination, hazard review, operating procedures,

training, maintenance and compliance audits.

4. The 5 Year Accident History

This site has had no reportable accidents during the past 5 years.

5. Emergency Response Plan

This facility has a written Emergency Action Plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. All

employees are trained on this plan and that training is documented. The Emerg

ency Action Plan is available

to all employees at all times in the workplace.

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

*******Internal safety audits are completed annually. Any items needing corrective actions are documented and the

corrective actions are put in place by the Operations Manager. Confirmation of the corrective actions being

put in place is done by the Director/VP of Operations. The most recent audit at this facility identified the following: An emergency evacuation drill and a shelter in place had not been performed. Also a respirator plan was not in place. These issues are expected to be complete by 11/30/15.
